Can I use a normal tablet for drawing?

Yes, while you can use a normal tablet for drawing, it won’t be as effective. What are the disadvantages of drawing tablets?

One of the main drawbacks of the drawing tablets may be the learning curve and adjustment period required, especially for those transitioning from traditional art mediums. The absence of tactile feedback can also be a disadvantage, as artists may miss the physical sensation of drawing on paper or canvas.
Additionally, high-quality drawing tablets can be expensive, requiring a significant initial investment. Finally, there can be potential issues with screen disconnection, compatibility with different devices or software, and the need for regular maintenance.

How long do drawing tablets last?

The durability and longevity of drawing tablets depend on factors such as the quality of the tablet, frequency of use, handling, and maintenance.
